snippet.title: Police confirm body's identity
snippet.content:
SCENE: Police close Nobbys breakwall on Sunday after the discovery of a man's body. The body was identified on Monday. Picture: Marina Neil
A BODY found on the rocks at Nobbys breakwall at the weekend has been identified. Detectives identified the man on Monday and will seek to contact the 56-year-old's next of kin.
Police confirmed they are not treating the death as suspicious at this stage, but a post-mortem on Tuesday will reveal more. The man's body was discovered on Sunday. Authorities quickly closed the breakwall as a crime scene was established.
Meanwhile, there were no suspicious circumstances deemed after another grisly discovery in Carrington on Monday, with police finding a body in a car at the boat ramp on Tully Street shortly before 9am.
A report will be prepared for the coroner.
